required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identification of Novel Biomarkers of Cervicovaginal Mucosal Inflammation
clinical_study.official_title: Identification of Novel Biomarkers of Cervicovaginal Mucosal Inflammation

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the response of vaginal and cervical tissue after exposure to three vaginal products: hydroxyethyl cellulose (HEC) placebo, nonoxynol-9 (N9) and imiquimod (IMQ) cream.

primary_outcome.measure: Differential Microarray gene expression (particularly looking at pathways involved in inflammation and immune response) in vaginal tissues after exposure to N9, HEC or imiquimod
primary_outcome.time_frame: Biopsies are performed 8 - 18 hours after exposure to each product
primary_outcome.description: These data are still undergoing analysis

arm_group.description: Participants first have sampling in the follicular and luteal phases of the menstrual cycle. Then participants receive 4 doses of HEC placebo gel in the luteal phase. Finally, participants are randomized to the order of IMiquimod, 2 doses vaginally, in the luteal phase and nonoxynol-9, 4%, 4 doses vaginally in the luteal phase.

Finally, participants are randomized to the order of IMiquimod, 2 doses vaginally, in the luteal phase and nonoxynol-9, 4%, 4 doses vaginally in the luteal phase.

clinical_study.keyword: Vaginal innate immune and inflammatory responses
